heading: Creating Forms for a table
exampleDescription:
Most tables will need forms to add new information to them. This could be, for example, a table storing information about pupils. In this situation the form would allow you to enter details about a newly enrolled pupil, so you should have some way of entering each of these details. Check out the example below, where the Pupil form correlates to the table that it adds data to:





So in general, for each column in the table you should have some way for the user to input this. You can then add this information to the table when the user clicks the “Done” button using an INSERT query. So for this example:
